abstract: The Fusion may not be as miserly on gasoline as the Toyota Prius, but the Ford has the handsome chiseled lines that many hybrids lack.
snippet: The Fusion may not be as miserly on gasoline as the Toyota Prius, but the Ford has the handsome chiseled lines that many hybrids lack.
lead_paragraph: There was a time not so very long ago when a vehicle’s high fuel economy was something worth bragging about (you know who you are, Prius owners). Then gasoline became cheap and hybrids began stacking up like so much cordwood on dealership lots. Some buyers still seek lofty miles-per-gallon numbers, but the clear trend has been toward bigger, thirsty vehicles. At least until gas hits $4 again.

headline.main: Video Review: Ford Fusion Hybrid Combines Savings and Style
headline.print_headline: Ford Fusion Hybrid: A Fuel Saver That’s Roomy and Refined
